comments.body:
Can you change this to:

```yaml
fn: uvcdat-{{ version }}.tar.gz
url: https://github.com/UV-CDAT/uvcdat/archive/v{{ version }}.tar.gz
sha256: b46323af67dcf5ff62ab4847aaaa7a52bb4d0386a3380f8049134aaedb3cee9b
BTW, the reason for this is so we download only the dist tarball instead of cloning the whole repo. That saves us some CI time down the road.

I saw other people using `archive` directory under `github.com`, but did not find good documentation for it.  

I think that this is a very neat way to download the `github` package especially having the checksum.   If it saves time that is even better, this package is big and can take time to download on `travis`.  :wink:

We are always lacking with our docs and you are correct, we do need to document this properly.
BTW, in case you are interested, here is what we have for docs so far: http://conda-forge.github.io/docs/

Feedback is welcomed :wink:

So you know,  I tried docker behind our firewall to your script `run_docker_build.sh`

I had to add my local certificate on Ubuntu for docker to load the image using `https`
```bash
* Copy CA cert to /usr/local/share/ca-certificates.
* sudo update-ca-certificates
* sudo service docker restart
```

As well, I changed you script and add the following conda command to theCONDARC section:
```
...
always_yes: true   
show_channel_urls: true    
**ssl_verify:false**
CONDARC  
)  
```

Not sure if those changes will be welcomed upstream, but you can try to discuss them at:

https://github.com/conda-forge/conda-smithy/blob/master/conda_smithy/templates/run_docker_build.tmpl

Or at least help us improve the docs with that workaround in case others find themselves in the same situation.
